snippet: Former President Bill Clinton tried to rebut Republican arguments against the re-election of President Obama in a major speech at the Democratic National Convention Wednesday.

byline.original: By CARL HULSE and JEFF ZELENY

lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- Former President Bill Clinton tried to rebut Republican arguments against the re-election of President Obama in a major speech at the Democratic National Convention Wednesday night, saying Mr. Obama has taken steps to turn around an economy left in shambles by Republicans. ''In Tampa, the Republican argument against the president's re-election was pretty simple: We left him a total mess, he hasn't finished cleaning it up yet, so fire him and put us back in,'' Mr. Clinton said.

headline.main: Obama Counting on Clinton to Help Sway Independent Voters
